iana.template_text:
(registered 2014-11-10, last updated 2014-11-10)

MIME media type name : Application

MIME subtype name : Vendor Tree - vnd.apache.thrift.compact

Required parameters : none

Optional parameters : none

Encoding considerations : binary

Security considerations : 
Apache Thrift does not enforce a security mechanism.
Users define security features at application or transport level.
The data carried by Apache Thrift is essentially arbitrary, and can include
active or executable content. Apache Thrift does not provide or enforce a
security mechanism, so appropriate mechanisms must be implemented at the
application or transport level.

Interoperability considerations : 
Today only x-thrift is used and we have different protocols.
The endpoints need to know what protocol is used and the Content-Type within
the HTTP Headers is only informal. We want to fix this with proper 
Content-Types.
That's why we do the registration here and adopt it on Apache Thrift 
afterwards.

Published specification : 
http://thrift.apache.org

Applications which use this media : 
Users do specify their own data structures and services via an interface description 
language (IDL) to communicate fast across languages and platforms.

Fragment identifier considerations :
not applicable

Restrictions on usage :
no restrictions, software is Apache License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

Additional information :

1. Deprecated alias names for this type : x-thrift
2. Magic number(s) : not available
3. File extension(s) : not available
4. Macintosh file type code : not available
5. Object Identifiers: not available

Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : Roger Meier
2. Email : roger&apache.org

Intended usage : Common
Efficient communication across languages and platforms.

Author/Change controller : Roger Meier - Apache Thrift PMC Member
